title_item: Annual number of days with extreme humid-heat

title_collection: Annual Global High-Resolution Extreme Heat Estimates, v1
description_collection: The Annual Global High-Resolution Extreme Heat Estimates (GEHE), 1983-2016 data set provides global 0.05 degrees (~5 km) gridded annual counts of the number of days where the maximum Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGTmax) exceeded dangerous hot-humid heat thresholds for the period 1983 to 2016.
provider: NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC)
link_website: Annual Global High-Resolution Extreme Heat Estimates (GEHE), v1: Satellite-Derived Environmental Indicators | SEDAC (columbia.edu)

description_item: High Resolution Daily Extreme Urban Heat Exposure, calculated for five combined temperture-humidity thresholds
title_collection: Global High Resolution Daily Extreme Urban Heat Exposure, v1
description_collection: The Global High Resolution Daily Extreme Urban Heat Exposure (UHE-Daily), 1983-2016 data set contains a high-resolution, longitudinal global record of geolocated urban extreme heat events and urban population exposure estimates for more than 10,000 urban settlements worldwide for 1983-2016.
provider: NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC)
link_website: Documentation » Global High Resolution Daily Extreme Urban Heat Exposure (UHE-Daily), v1: Satellite-Derived Environmental Indicators | SEDAC (columbia.edu)

title_item: Flood recurrence 2 years return period, Flood recurrence 5 years return period, lood recurrence 10 years return period, Flood recurrence 50 years return period, Maximum river discharge, Minimum river discharge
description_item: Return values of annual maximum river discharge. Data are provided as the 2, 5, 10 and 50 year return period of annual daily maximum river discharge estimated using a Gumbel distribution. Maximum river discharge is calculated as the mean annual daily maximum discharge over a 30 year period. 	Minimum river discharge is calculated as the mean annual daily minimum discharge over a 30 year period.
title_collection: Hydrology-related climate impact indicators from 1970 to 2100 derived from bias adjusted European climate projections
description_collection: "This dataset provides water variables and indicators based on hydrological impact modelling, forced by bias adjusted regional climate simulations from the European Coordinated Regional Climate Downscaling Experiment (EURO-CORDEX). The dataset contains Essential Climate Variable (ECV) data in the form of daily mean river discharge and a set of climate impact indicators (CIIs) for both water quantity and quality."

description_item: 6-Month Standardized Precipitation Index
title_collection: Gridded monthly climate projection dataset underpinning the IPCC AR6 Interactive Atlas
description_collection: "This catalogue entry provides gridded data from global (CMIP5 and CMIP6) and regional (CORDEX) projections for the set of 22 variables and indices included in the IPCC Interactive Atlas, a novel contribution from Working Group I (WGI) to the IPCC Sixth Assessment Report (AR6). These variables and indices are relevant for the climatic impact-drivers used in the regional assessments conducted in AR6 (Chapters 10, 11, 12 and Atlas), related to heat and cold, wet and dry, snow and ice, and wind."

title_collection: Climate extreme indices and heat stress indicators derived from CMIP6 global climate projections
description_collection: "The dataset provides climate extreme indices related to temperature and precipitation as defined by the Expert Team on Climate Change Detection and Indices (ETCCDI), as well as selected heat stress indicators (HSI). The indices are provided for historical and future climate projections (SSP1-2.6, SSP2-4.5, SSP3-7.0, SSP5-8.5) included in the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project Phase 6 (CMIP6) and used in the 6th Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC)."

title_item: JRC flood hazard maps Europe and the Mediterranean
description_item: The datasets included in this collection depict flood prone areas in Europe and the Mediterranean for river flood events of different magnitude, i.e. different six return periods from 1-in-10-year to 1-in-500-year events. The maps have been developed using hydrological and hydrodynamic models, driven by the climatological data of the European Flood Awareness Systems (EFAS). European-scale maps comprise most of the geographical Europe and all the river basins entering the Mediterranean and Black Seas in the Caucasus, Middle East and Northern Africa countries.
title_collection: JRC flood hazard maps
description_collection: The datasets included in this collection depict flood prone areas in Europe and the World for river flood events of different magnitude, i.e. different six return periods from 1-in-10-year to 1-in-500-year events. The maps have been developed using hydrological and hydrodynamic models, driven by the climatological data of the European and Global Flood Awareness Systems (EFAS and GloFAS). European-scale maps comprise most of the geographical Europe and all the river basins entering the Mediterranean and Black Seas in the Caucasus, Middle East and Northern Africa countries.
underlying_data: several data sources (see publication for further details)
usage_notes: Cell values indicate water depth (in m)

description_item: The datasets included in this collection depict flood prone areas in the World for river flood events of different magnitude, i.e. different six return periods from 1-in-10-year to 1-in-500-year events. The maps have been developed using hydrological and hydrodynamic models, driven by the climatological data of the Global Flood Awareness Systems (GloFAS).

title_item: River discharge in the last 24 hours
description_item: Volume rate of water flow, including sediments, chemical and biological material, in the river channel averaged over a time step through a cross-section. The value is an average over the 24-hour time step.
title_collection: Seasonal reforecasts of river discharge and related data from the Global Flood Awareness System
description_collection: The dataset provides a gridded modelled time series of river discharge forced with seasonal range meteorological reforecasts. The data is a consistent representation of a key hydrological variable across the global domain, and is a product of the Global Flood Awareness System (GloFAS).
usage_notes: Temporal coverage up to near real-time (several months delay), with monthly updates.

title_item: River discharge in the last 24 hours
description_item: Volume rate of water flow, including sediments, chemical and biological material, in the river channel averaged over a time step through a cross-section. The value is an average over the 24-hour time step.
title_collection: Reforecasts of river discharge and related data by the Global Flood Awareness System
description_collection: This dataset provides a gridded modelled time series of river discharge, forced with medium- to sub-seasonal range meteorological reforecasts. The data is a consistent representation of a key hydrological variable across the global domain, and is a product of the Global Flood Awareness System (GloFAS).
usage_notes: Reforecasts are generated in near real time for each Monday and Thursday as reference dates, 46-day lead time. For each reference date, reforecasts are produced for the past 20 years from 2003 to 2022 (inclusive). The first available reforecast reference date is the 2023-03-27.

description_item: Number of hot days in a year using specific definitions, i.e. climatological, health and country related.
title_collection: Heat waves and cold spells in Europe derived from climate projections
description_collection: The dataset contains the number of hot and cold spell days using different European-wide and national/regional definitions developed within the C3S European Health service. These heat wave and cold spell days are available for different future time periods and use different climate change scenarios.

description_item: Highest five-day precipitation amount is defined as the maximum of 5-day precipitation totals. The value is given as a maximum over a 30 year period. For future periods the indicator is given as a relative change against the reference period (1971-2000).
title_collection: Temperature and precipitation climate impact indicators from 1970 to 2100 derived from European climate projections

description_item: Longest dry spells is defined as the maximum number of consecutive dry days (dry day: daily precipitation < 1mm) over a 30 year period. For future periods the indicator is given as a relative change against the reference period (1971-2000).

usage_notes: Two spatial resolution: 5km x 5km and 0.11° x 0.11°

description_item: Number of dry spells is defined as the number of dry periods (dry day: daily precipitation < 1mm) of more than 5 days for a 30 year period. For future periods the indicator is given as a relative change against the reference period (1971-2000).

title_item: Synthetic windstorm events for Europe from 1986 to 2011
description_item: a set of synthetic windstorm events consisting of 22,980 individual storm footprints over Europe. These are a physically realistic set of plausible windstorm events based on the modelled climatic conditions. It is not designed to reproduce actual historical observations but as a comparator for the stochastic event sets generally used for windstorm risk analysis in the insurance industry.
title_collection: Synthetic windstorm events for Europe from 1986 to 2011

title_item: Crop yield reduction under rainfed conditions
description_item: Reduction of crop yields under rainfed conditions against irrigation due to precipitation scarcity.
title_collection: Yield reduction of 14 crops grown in Europe derived from EURO-CORDEX climate projections
description_collection: The dataset provides information about yield reduction of 14 crops due to precipitation scarcity if they are grown under rainfed conditions rather than irrigated.
underlying_data: EURO-CORDEX, Digital Elevation Model, Soil Available Water Capacity

title_item: Annual Global High-Resolution Extreme Heat Estimates annual rate of increase
title_collection: Annual Global High-Resolution Extreme Heat Estimates
description_collection: The Annual Global High-Resolution Extreme Heat Estimates (GEHE), 1983-2016 data set provides global 0.05 degrees (~5 km) gridded annual counts of the number of days where the maximum Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGTmax) exceeded dangerous hot-humid heat thresholds for the period 1983 to 2016.
provider: NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC)
usage_notes: free user account needed

description_item: A global daily drought index dataset named as daily evapotranspiration deficit index (DEDI) is constructed using daily actual evapotranspiration and potential evapotranspiration data provided by European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts Reanalysis v5 (ERA5).
